events.name: Google Open Source Track at FOSSASIA Summit: Web, Android, Tensorflow, Chrome OS
events.description:
LIMITED FREE TICKETS BEFORE MARCH 13: Join us for insights to Open Source development at Google. The latest in web tech, Android, Chrome OS, AI and Data Science with Tensorflow, and Google Open Source developer programs like Code-In is covered in this track. 


AGENDA 09:00 - 09:25 Google Code-In, Stephanie Taylor (Google Open Source Programs Office) 09:30 - 10:00 Future of Web, Anuvrat Rao (Google) 10:05 - 10:35 TensorFlow 1.0: open source machine learning, Andrew Selle (Google Brain Team) 10:40 - 11:10 Chrome OS, Super Dev (Google) 11:15 - 11:45 MVVM architecture with Data Bindings, Denis Nek (Google's Developer Experts)  Find out more details here: http://2017.fossasia.org/rooms.html#venue-3006 


GET FREE TICKETS BEFORE MARCH 13 1) Sign up now on the meetup group. 2) Be fast! A limited number of attendees using the following link will get free entrance on Saturday and a lunch box voucher: https://eventyay.com/e/45da88b7/?code=GOOGLEOPEN (Choose ticket "Google Track" and signup before March 13 or choose 3 Day Community Ticket with 20% off). You will also have access to all other sessions on Saturday with the free ticket. 


LINKS Google Cloud: http://google.com/cloud Tensorflow: https://www.tensorflow.org FOSSASIA Summit: http://2017.fossasia.org Google Open Source Track: http://2017.fossasia.org/rooms.html#venue-3006
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, Dalton Hall, 15 Science Centre Road , Singapore 609081

events.name: PowerShell User Group Meetup
events.description:
Hi, 



Would like to invite you all to our PowerShell UG meetup. We will have to sessions: First session with Jaap Brasser our PowerShell Conference speaker Jaap Brasser is an Automation and Cloud Engineer and PowerShell MVP with a big passion for scripting and automation. As an IT professional Jaap is part of several professional communities, speaks at technical events and writes articles on a variety of subjects on his personal blog and other websites or magazines. As an active member of the PowerShell community he supports users providing answers in forums, blogs about PowerShell and creates and shares PowerShell modules, functions and scripts. Blog: http://www.jaapbrasser.com/ Twitter:  https://twitter.com/jaap_brasser GitHub: https://github.com/jaapbrasser TechNet: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Profile/Jaap%20Brasser Writing PowerShell – The right tool for the job  In this session, I will take you through my own story of writing my PowerShell code. I will share my own lessons learned, how I approach new PowerShell projects and share a lot of examples of how to configure and simplify the you write your PowerShell code.  Second session with Rakesh  Rakesh is automation expert, working on PowerShell for over 8 years and recently starting working on IoT. PowerShell on IoT Rakesh will be giving a demo on establishing communication between Raspberry pi and a sensor device using Powershell. 


See you all 18 March
events.location: Microsoft Operations Pte Ltd, 22CF12, Level 22, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: Kernel and Platform track at FOSSASIA Summit
events.description: Join us for the latest topics surrounding kernel development, ARM platforms and virtualisation. AGENDA 10:30 - 10:55 Recommending Code Changes for Automatic Backporting of Linux Device Drivers - Ferdian Thung (Singapore Management University) 11:00 - 11:25 Linux-Sunxi: Community behind Allwinner SOCs mainline support - Vishnu Patekar (linux-sunxi.org) 12:40 - 13:05 Develop UEFI with openSUSE - Gary Lin (SUSE) 13:10 - 13:35 Coccinelle: Finding bugs in the Linux Kernel - Vaishali Thakkar (Oracle) 13:40 - 14:05 FreeBSD is not a Linux Distro - Philip Paeps (The FreeBSD Foundation) 14:10 - 15:05 Industrial IO and You- Nonsense Hacks! - workshop 1hr - Matt Ranostay (Konsulko Group) 15:10 - 15:35 The Qemu/KVM ecosystem: Navigating the code! - Bandan Das (Red Hat) 15:40 - 16:05 KVM Nested Virtualization: Workings and Use-cases - workshop 30mins - Bandan Das (Red Hat) 16:10 - 16:35 Hello Wayland, Goodbye X11 - The year of the Linux desktop! - workshop 1hr - Carsten Haitzler (Samsung Electronics / Enlightenment) 16:40 - 17:05 How to custom our own plymouth theme - Zhao Qiang (SUSE) TICKETSThe FOSSASIA Summit takes place from 17-19th March in the Science Centre. Please get your ticket here: https://eventyay.com/e/45da88b7/ LINKSFOSSASIA: https://2017.fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/1874873046058383/
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, Faraday (Floor 3), 15 Science Centre Road

events.name: First Code Academy Demo Day (Mar 18)
events.description:
Dear parents and students, 
We hope you are having fun learning coding! It's time now for our traditional Demo Day event, where graduating students are invited to showcase and talk about their very own app creations!
At First Code, we strongly believe in the power of sharing knowledge and ideas - one of our classroom rules is "I love nice people who make cools things"! Our Demo Day is a wonderful platform for students to stand proud showcase their amazing projects to family and friends.
All students, parents and friends are invited to join our Demo Day this March. There will be showcase of custom projects from all our students, plus food and games for all!
 
Demo Day Event Details

Date: March 18, Saturday
Time: 10:00am - 12:00pm
Venue: First Code Academy, #04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

Hope to see you there and bring your friends and family! 
 
Note: Please register separate tickets for family/friends attending and for students presenting.
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at hellosg@firstcodeacademy.com
events.location: First Code Academy Singapore, #04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

events.name: HHSG BUILD: MARCH 18
events.description:
Bring your lunch :) Continuing from our previous meeting on the same project. Current project: Social Privilege Calculator - Where do you sit on the meritocracy/parentocracy scale? For updates, join us on these platforms: SLACKhttps://hhsg-slack.herokuapp.com/ TRELLO BOARDhttps://trello.com/invite/b/wDIl5vep/6347f978659531692bee1cb22db12396/hhsg-build GITHUBhttps://github.com/HHSG/privilegecalculator 


Next steps • For data: Keep working on primary school rankings - clean up the dataset and maybe compile other datasets to help cross-reference or merge • For devs: Look at the interface and see how to integrate the questions in a conversational style 'chat-bot' format. Check on spelling errors and ways to verify the information.  • For design: Let's maybe start looking at adding some flair? Icons, colours, style.
events.location: ST Innovation Lab - SPH, 1000 Toa Payoh North, Singapore

events.name: Create Your Own Android App
events.description: This is a group for anyone interested in creating your own android app without any knowledge on programming language. I created some android apps absolutely ZERO cost without knowing a single line of programming language like JAVA. My Sample Android Apps: https://youtu.be/DVZfFnF39k4 ( https://youtu.be/DVZfFnF39k4 ) http://bit.ly/amslereyetest ( http://bit.ly/amslereyetest ) http://bit.ly/amslerdownloader ( http://bit.ly/amslerdownloader ) I started this group to meet other people wanting to create their own android app, for business, for prototyping, for hobby, for fun etc. It is workshop(one to one, small group, video call, online hangout etc). Participants will have a chance to build an Android App with their bare hands and install the app on their Android phone. ----------------- Workshop Summary Who: 1. People who want to build their very own Android app without knowing a single line of JAVA codes. 2. People who want to pick up a Tech hobby with friends and family. 3. People who want to realise their amazing idea into a workable app. 4. People who want to know the basic mobile app development framework the easy and practical way. What: It is workshop(one to one, small group or online meetup). Participants will have a chance to build an Android App with their bare hands and install the app on their Android phone at the end of the session. Where: Anywhere with good wifi. Cosy venue can be arranged if confirmation was made early. when: Message organiser your prefer time and date Workshop Fee: $50/pax for online meetup(whatsapp video call, google hangout or zoom etc)$80/pax (face to face meetup) Required Items: Laptop and Android phone. ---------------------- Schedule 2.5 to 3 hours : Create your very own Android App workshop.1. User interface construction2. Call image capturing function3. Call speach function4. Logo construction 0.5 hour : Q&A ---------------------- Suggestions If you have any further questions, feel free to email me at [masked] Cheerios, David CH Organiser URL: https://www.facebook.com/Droidappsmaker-1267710249984060/ ( https://www.facebook.com/Droidappsmaker-1267710249984060/ ) Looking forward to exploring the Android app development without the knowledge of programming language with everybody.
events.location: OTC Cafe, National Library, L3, Singapore

events.name: How to Setup a Nextcloud Instance & Start Collaborating
events.description: In this workshop Frank will explain how to install and setup an Nextcloud server. Nextcloud can be installed on a small Raspberry Pi like device or on a bigger Linux system. Basic knowledge of Linux and webservers is recommended. Another topic of this workshop will be how to start collaborating with other users using the Nextcloud federation feature. The workshop takes place at the FOSSASIA Summit at the Science Centre Singapore. A limited number of free tickets are available using this link: https://eventyay.com/e/45da88b7/?code=Nextcloud                                 Frank Karlitschek, Founder of Nextcloud  ABOUT FRANK Frank Karlitschek is a free software developer, entrepreneur and privacy activist. He founded the Nextcloud and the ownCloud projects and was involved in several other free software projects. He published the “User Data Manifesto” and is a regular keynote speaker at conferences like CCC, LinuxCon, Latinoware, openSUSE Conf, Akademy and now FOSSASIA. LINKS Website: http://nextcloud.com
events.location: Science Centre, 15 Science Centre Road , Singapore

events.name: AsiaVR Tech Talks: Technology and Research
events.description:
IEEE-NUS student branch, NUS ECE Club and AsiaVR are jointly organizing this tech talk that aims to brings together VR companies, NUS researchers and the community. We are inviting members and companies who are making all types of VR development/applications to understand some of the latest technology and research in VR, for instance tracking and multisensory experiences. This is also a good opportunity to connect to the NUS researchers and students. Best of all, its free like all AsiaVR events! So sign up now! Limited slots available! Agenda: 1:30pm Registration2:00 pm - 3:30 pm Technical presentations3:30 pm - 3:45 pm Break and light refreshments3:45 pm - 4.30 pm Hands-on VR Experience session (Demo time!) Technical presentations 2:00pm - VR introduction, history and emerging trendsDr Khoo Eng Tat, NUS Engineering Design and Innovation Center 2:20pm - Room Scale Laser Tracking, the Valve Lighthouse solutions and beyondLeong Tuck Weng, Lemon Imaging 2:40pm - Procedural digital assets for VR and interactive content development with Houdini Engine, Unity and Unreal  TK NG, SideFX Asia Pacific  3:00pm - Multisensory VR: smell, taste, and haptic simulationDr Nimesha Ranasinghe, Keio-NUS Cute Center Hands-on VR Experience session: 1. Keio-NUS CUTE Center – Ambiotherm wearable research prototype that provides additional thermal and air-flow sensations to traditional VR experience. 2. Actually Sane Studios - Danger Room shooter game 3. Kaiju Den - Mobile VR horror game - walk into Ancient Mansion 4. SideFX Studios - Immersive VR demo 


Note on getting there: Bus 183, 96 from Clementi MRT. Alight at first bus stop (16159) in NUS, then walk up the stairs.Uber or Grab, key in "NUS Engineering Auditorium"Driving, park at Car Park 2A (in front of E3A) Follow us on Facebook - AsiaVR:https://www.facebook.com/groups/asiavr/
events.location: NUS Engineering LT7A (next to Engineering Auditorium) , 1 Engineering Drive 2, Singapore 117576
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group

events.name: PGP/GPG Keysigning at FOSSASIA 2017
events.description:
We are organizing a key-signing event at FOSSASIA. We will gather around at 14:00 on Saturday at the exhibition area a.k.a Scientist for a Day. For more info check https://www.cryptoparty.in/singapore and http://2017.fossasia.org/schedule.html#s-2851 You are all welcome! It's not too late to create a GPG key and collect some signatures. Check this how to: http://cryptnet.net/fdp/crypto/keysigning_party/en/keysigning_party.html 


=== PLAN === Here is the plan of the day: 1. Put your information into the pad: https://piratenpad.de/p/fossasia2017-key Your full name, key length and type, key fingerprint. I will bring a computer, you can use it if you don’t have one with you.2. After collecting all the keys and checking for correctness, we will close the file and create its hash. We will read this hash while everybody take a note of it.3. I will put the file online, so that you will be able to download it to your phones.4. We will form a line and start checking IDs. If you are convinced that the person is who she claims to be, take note of it.5. After everybody check everybody, we will be done for the day. For your convenience, I will download the keys, create a keyring, and send it to everyone.6. When you get home, you can check the hash of the file that you have downloaded against the hash code that you have noted down. If they match, continue signing; if not, stop, there should be something fishy going on.7. You can use the caff tool on the keyring that you will receive from me. Don’t forget to cross-check the fingerprints with the ones in your file.
events.location: Science Centre, 15 Science Centre Road , Singapore

events.name: Hands-on Deep Learning Workshop
events.description:
We will tackle cutting edge' topics in Deep Learning. Participants will be able to install the working examples on their own machines, and tweak and extend them for themselves. Virtual Box Appliances will be distributed on USB drives. The workshop takes place at the FOSSASIA Summit. Please get your ticket to the FOSSASIA Summit here: https://eventyay.com/e/45da88b7/ 


SETUP The set-up has been proven to work well. Since this is hands-on, some familiarity with installing, running and playing with software will be assumed. Depending on demand, I can also do a quick intro about Deep Learning itself, though that would be pretty well-trodden ground that people who are interested would have seen several times before.                                                Martin Andrews, Red Cat Labs ABOUT Martin Andrews Martin has a PhD in Machine Learning, and has been an Open Source developer since 1999. After a career in finance (based in London and New York), he decided to follow his original passion, and now works on Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence full-time. Martin has given several talks and workshops on Deep Learning over the last 12 months, including FOSSASIA, PyConSG, DataScienceSG and at the Fifth Elephant conference (in India). LINKS Deep Learning Repo: https://github.com/mdda/deep-learning-workshop Github: https://github.com/mdda Linkedin: https://sg.linkedin.com/in/martinandrews
events.location: Science Centre, 15 Science Centre Road , Singapore
